channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What does it take for a famine to be declared in Gaza?
item.description: Reports of starvation in Gaza raise the questions: Why the hesitation in labeling it a famine? And who are the authorities with the power to make that...

item.title: Dear Life Kit: My friend says ugly things about her body and it makes me anxious
item.description: Body-acceptance advocate Katie Sturino and Ronald Young Jr., host of the podcast Weight for It , answer listener questions about body image, weight lo...

item.title: Trump and Fed chairman clash over renovation site cost. And, Gaza peace talks stalled
item.description: Trump and Fed Chairman Jerome Powell clashed over the cost of renovations to the Federal Reserve headquarters. And, ceasefire talks between Israel and...

item.title: 'Outrageous' dramatizes the lives of the Mitford sisters
item.description: The six British sisters are the subject of a new Britbox series. In 1989, Jessica Mitford talked with Terry Gross about her relationship with the Comm...

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein files: Tracing the legal cases that led to sex-trafficking charges
item.description: Questions persist about how Jeffrey Epstein, who once moved among the world's elite, was able to avoid federal prosecution for so long. A timeline sug...

item.title: French pledge to recognise Palestine is a gamble - so will Starmer follow suit?
item.description: The prime minister is facing pressure at home and abroad to recognise a Palestinian state.

item.title: Trump says he's considering rebate checks for Americans based on tariffs
item.description: President Trump said he's considering using money generated by U.S. tariffs to offer a "little rebate" to Americans.

item.title: Deportation flights from Florida's "Alligator Alcatraz" underway, DeSantis says
item.description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis said deportation flights from the so-called"Alligator Alcatraz" immigration detention facility had begun. CBS News Miami rep...

item.title: A man is stopped climbing the US-Mexico border wall. Under new Trump rules, US troops sound the alarm
"Doomsday mom" Lori Vallow Daybell receives new life sentences
item.description: Lori Vallow Daybell has been sentenced to life in prison on two murder conspiracy convictions in Arizona.

item.title: In Epstein furor, Trump struggles to shake off a controversy his allies once stoked
item.description: President Donald Trump faces ongoing questions about the Jeffrey Epstein case, overshadowing his administration’s achievements.

item.title: Former Congolese president on trial for treason
item.description: Joseph Kabila denies backing the M23 rebels, who have seized large parts of the mineral-rich east.

item.title: 220 MPs call for Starmer to recognise Palestinian state
item.description: The PM says recognition of a Palestinian state must be part of a "wider plan" to ensure peace in the region.

item.title: Meeting over between US official and Ghislane Maxwell, who will 'welcome any relief', lawyer says
item.description: When asked about giving Maxwell clemency, the president said he was allowed to do so, but had "not thought" about it.

item.title: Deportation flights from Florida’s ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ detention center have begun, DeSantis says
Almost a third of people in Gaza not eating for days, UN food programme warns
item.description: Israel faces increasing pressure from Western allies to lift restrictions into the flow of aid into Gaza.

item.title: What did Lori Vallow Daybell do? A timeline of the case
item.description: A Phoenix jury has convicted Lori Vallow Daybell of conspiracy in the murder of her estranged husband Charles Vallow.

item.title: 9-year-old dies after incident at Hersheypark's water park, CEO says
item.description: A 9-year-old child has died after an incident at The Boardwalk water park at Hersheypark in Hershey, Pennsylvania, on Thursday.
